name: Exordium Canyon
description:
A reece was undertaken to explore the prospect of a canyon existing on Terrace creek. This yielded the discovery of a breathtaking tableland on Mt Glennie covered in ferns, palm trees and walking stick palms. The ridgeline up was difficult - kilometers of Lantana. Because of this, we ran out of time to descend into the main event of the canyon. We were able to abseil the first waterfall, approximately 55-60 meters of rope used. The section immediately below this fall contained ~100m of creek hopping covered in giant rocks, gaps in the rocks showed evidence of a possible river cave existing there. Below this is what is expected to be the main canyon. The only section o seen was what looked like multi-tier falls (extremely steep cascades), which looked like 2x50m pitches (due to the angle). No good natural anchors were seen near the edge of the first of these falls. Future exhibitions should access the top of the plateau via the creek with a walk up the ridge on creek left.
